newsitem.title: USA: Quantech Ltd still sees '97 product launch.
newsitem.headline: Quantech Ltd still sees '97 product launch.

text.p: Quantech Ltd, which is developing a medical diagnostic system for hospital critical care units, said Thursday it continues to expect to begin selling the system in 1997.

The first test planned for commercial introduction is one designed to detect and quantify cardiac "markers" that aid physicians in assessing whether or not a patient has had a heart attack, Quantech said in its first quarter statement.

"We are working to complete development of our commercial prototype so that we can begin collection of data to support our ... application to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration," president and chief executive officer Joseph Shaw said in the statement.
"We continue to anticipate a market launch of the product in 1997 and are excited about the technology and the reception we have had from the marketplace," he said.
Quantech said its surface plasmon resonance technology is being designed to provide rapid, quantitative results using whole blood.
Plans call for development of additional tests using the system, Quantech said.

As reported earlier, Quantech reported a net loss of $706,797, equal to $0.02 a share, for the first quarter ended September 30, versus a $558,067 or $0.07 a share loss a year ago. The company now has a weighted average of 46.9 million shares outstanding versus 8.3 million a year ago.
The company said the increased loss was due to higher research and development and administrative expenses.
